numbered_ace_sentences: 3. I noticed a fact from the graph.
4. Legacy applicants have a significantly higher admissions rate across the board.
5. The admissions rate of legacy applicants is more than twice the average admissions rate.
6. Applicants with higher parental income have a larger benefit.
7. The top 0.1% income group has an admissions rate that is up to 7 times the average admissions rate.
8. Non-legacy applicants have an admissions rate that is less than 3 times the average admissions rate.
10. Admissions are heavily skewed in favor of high-income legacy applicants.
11. I ask why admissions are heavily skewed in favor of high-income legacy applicants.
13. I ask what steps colleges can take to reduce this bias.
